title: ICE on non-exhaustive match for fixed-size array (middle::check_match::construct_witness)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following code

``` rust
fn main() {
    let chunk_type: [u8; 4] = [73, 72, 68, 82];
    match &chunk_type {
        b"IHDR" => ()
    }
}
```

triggers an ICE:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `1`, right: `4`)', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/librustc/middle/check_match.rs:542

stack backtrace:

   9:        0x1025db6e0 - visit::walk_item::h15813185597560382321
```
